artists.biography: The Books were an American duo, formed in New York City in 1999, consisting of guitarist and vocalist Nick Zammuto and cellist Paul de Jong. Their releases typically incorporate samples of obscure sounds and speech. They have released three critically acclaimed albums on the German label Tomlab, and released their fourth studio album, The Way Out, on Temporary Residence Limited in July 2010.
artists.name: The Books

The Books.biography: The Books were an American duo, formed in New York City in 1999, consisting of guitarist and vocalist Nick Zammuto and cellist Paul de Jong. Their releases typically incorporate samples of obscure sounds and speech. They have released three critically acclaimed albums on the German label Tomlab, and released their fourth studio album, The Way Out, on Temporary Residence Limited in July 2010.

track.name: The Future, Wouldn't That Be Nice?
A True Story of a Story of True Love

wiki.content: The Lemon of Pink is the second album by The Books, released October 7, 2003 on the Tomlab record label. Initial critical response to The Lemon of Pink was very positive. At Metacritic, which assigns a normalized rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream critics, the album has received an average score of 86, based on 9 reviews. The online webzine Pitchfork Media placed "The Lemon of Pink" 20th on their top 100 albums of 2000-2004 "That Right Ain't Shit" was used as the soundtrack in an advertisement for a Hummer vehicle. "Tokyo" was used in a commercial for spreading awareness of HIV. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
